column4: Hi people. Im trying to get this oldpc to work and ubuntu is doing fine aparte from 1 problem. The wificard is not working. its a sitecom WL-140 and i followed this instructions http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-945299.html but its not working. Ive googled but i cant find more guides to workon. Anyone here has experience with this? lspci gives me this -> http://pastebin.com/HYtZr0mZ
have you looked into ndiswrapper?
the first link is a guide to use ndiswrapper, so. yes ive tried that
i might have done it wrong though ;)
there is a gui for it...gtkndis or some such....search for ndiswrapper in synaptic
is this a usb wifi?
no, one of those old bigass cards
make sure you are using the windows xp drivers and not windows 7....don't think they will work
how can i se what i got?
I usually go to the manufacturers website and download the latest drivers from there
you mind helping me to uninstall the vista driver i used first and replace it with the xp driver?
seems that is the problem
is it working now?
no. and when i try to install the xp driver it says the driver already is installed, wich is true, so i need to uninstall de vistadriver first
and for that i need help :)
the gtk thing should allow you to uninstall
'ndiswrapper -l' will list the installed drivers, and 'ndiswrapper -d <name>' will remove the installed drivers
reidar@reidar-Presario-R3200-PA473EA-ABN:~/Nedlastinger/WL-140v2$ ndiswrapper -lwl54cfg : driver installed
but no wifi :(
does the wifi show up in either ifconfig or iwconfig?
those are files i should have?
no...commands. Open a terminal and type each one (one at a time) and look through the resulting information to see if the wifi card is even mentioned
no mention ---> http://pastebin.com/N9K35CeD
I would check lshw and see if the card is even recognized. But I am not a wizard at desktop hw....maybe someone else can help.
